segment.source: title: Export and import virtual machines
segment.target: title: Export and import virtual machines

segment.source: Export and Import virtual machines
segment.target: Export and Import virtual machines

segment.source: 12-Nov update.
segment.target: 12-Nov update.

segment.source: You can use the export and import functionality to quickly duplicate virtual machines or to move them from one host to another.
segment.target: You can use the export and import functionality to quickly duplicate virtual machines or to move them from one host to another.

segment.source: You don't need to export a virtual machine to be able to import it.
segment.target: You don't need to export a virtual machine to be able to import it.

segment.source: You can simply copy a virtual machine and its associated files to the new host, and then use the Import Virtual Machine wizard to specify the location of the files.
segment.target: You can simply copy a virtual machine and its associated files to the new host, and then use the Import Virtual Machine wizard to specify the location of the files.

segment.source: This registers the virtual machine with Hyper-V and makes it available to be used.
segment.target: This registers the virtual machine with Hyper-V and makes it available to be used.

segment.source: Export virtual machines
segment.target: Export virtual machines

segment.source: An easy way to prepare virtual machines to be imported is the Export Virtual Machine wizard.
segment.target: An easy way to prepare virtual machines to be imported is the Export Virtual Machine wizard.

segment.source: In Hyper-V Manager, select one or multiple virtual machines, right-click on your selection and select Export.
segment.target: In Hyper-V Manager, select one or multiple virtual machines, right-click on your selection and select Export.

segment.source: Click Browse in the dialog box and choose where you would like to put the exported VM(s) and then click Select Folder.
segment.target: Click Browse in the dialog box and choose where you would like to put the exported VM(s) and then click Select Folder.

segment.source: In the Export Virtual Machine dialog, click Export.
segment.target: In the Export Virtual Machine dialog, click Export.

segment.source: For information about using Windows PowerShell to export virtual machines, see Export-VM
segment.target: For information about using Windows PowerShell to export virtual machines, see Export-VM

segment.source: Import virtual machines
segment.target: Import virtual machines

segment.source: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Action menu, click Import Virtual Machine.
segment.target: In Hyper-V Manager, in the Action menu, click Import Virtual Machine.

segment.source: In the Locate Folder section, click Browse and navigate to where the virtual machine files are located.
segment.target: In the Locate Folder section, click Browse and navigate to where the virtual machine files are located.

segment.source: Please note that using the wizard you can import one VM at a time and have to select the VM's folder instead of the general export folder.
segment.target: Please note that using the wizard you can import one VM at a time and have to select the VM's folder instead of the general export folder.

segment.source: Click Next when finished.
segment.target: Click Next when finished.

segment.source: Select the virtual machine to import and then click Next.
segment.target: Select the virtual machine to import and then click Next.

segment.source: In the Choose Import Type section, you can choose how to import the virtual machine:
segment.target: In the Choose Import Type section, you can choose how to import the virtual machine:

segment.source: Register - Uses the existing unique ID of the virtual machine and registers it in-place.
segment.target: Register - Uses the existing unique ID of the virtual machine and registers it in-place.

segment.source: Choose this option if the virtual machines files are already in the correct location.
segment.target: Choose this option if the virtual machines files are already in the correct location.

segment.source: Restore - Uses the original virtual machine’s unique ID and also copies the virtual machine files to the default location specified for the host.
segment.target: Restore - Uses the original virtual machine’s unique ID and also copies the virtual machine files to the default location specified for the host.

segment.source: Copy - Creates a new unique ID for the virtual machine and also copies the virtual machine files to the default location specified for the host.
segment.target: Copy - Creates a new unique ID for the virtual machine and also copies the virtual machine files to the default location specified for the host.

segment.source: After selecting how to import the VM, click Next.
segment.target: After selecting how to import the VM, click Next.

segment.source: In the Choose Destination section, you can choose where to store the files for the virtual machine or leave them in their current location.
segment.target: In the Choose Destination section, you can choose where to store the files for the virtual machine or leave them in their current location.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Next.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Next.

segment.source: In Choose Storage folders, you can select another place to store the .vhdx file or leave them where they are.
segment.target: In Choose Storage folders, you can select another place to store the .vhdx file or leave them where they are.

segment.source: When you are finished, click Next.
segment.target: When you are finished, click Next.

segment.source: When you have finished importing the VM, you'll see the summary page describing where the new VM files are located.
segment.target: When you have finished importing the VM, you'll see the summary page describing where the new VM files are located.

segment.source: The Import Virtual Machine wizard also walks you through the steps of addressing incompatibilities when you import the virtual machine to the new host—so this wizard can help with configuration that is associated with physical hardware, such as memory, virtual switches, and virtual processors.
segment.target: The Import Virtual Machine wizard also walks you through the steps of addressing incompatibilities when you import the virtual machine to the new host—so this wizard can help with configuration that is associated with physical hardware, such as memory, virtual switches, and virtual processors.

segment.source: To import a virtual machine, the wizard does the following:
segment.target: To import a virtual machine, the wizard does the following:

segment.source: Creates a copy of the virtual machine configuration file.
segment.target: Creates a copy of the virtual machine configuration file.

segment.source: This is done as a precaution in case an unexpected restart occurs on the host, such as from a power outage.
segment.target: This is done as a precaution in case an unexpected restart occurs on the host, such as from a power outage.

segment.source: Validates hardware.
segment.target: Validates hardware.

segment.source: Information in the virtual machine configuration file is compared to hardware on the new host.
segment.target: Information in the virtual machine configuration file is compared to hardware on the new host.

segment.source: Compiles a list of errors.
segment.target: Compiles a list of errors.

segment.source: This list identifies what needs to be reconfigured and determines which pages appear next in the wizard.
segment.target: This list identifies what needs to be reconfigured and determines which pages appear next in the wizard.

segment.source: Displays the relevant pages, one category at a time.
segment.target: Displays the relevant pages, one category at a time.

segment.source: The wizard explains each incompatibility to help you reconfigure the virtual machine so it is compatible with the new host.
segment.target: The wizard explains each incompatibility to help you reconfigure the virtual machine so it is compatible with the new host.

segment.source: Removes the copy of the configuration file.
segment.target: Removes the copy of the configuration file.

segment.source: After the wizard does this, the virtual machine is ready to be started.
segment.target: After the wizard does this, the virtual machine is ready to be started.

segment.source: In addition to the wizard, the Hyper-V module for Windows PowerShell includes cmdlets for importing virtual machines.
segment.target: In addition to the wizard, the Hyper-V module for Windows PowerShell includes cmdlets for importing virtual machines.

segment.source: For more information, see Import-VM.
segment.target: For more information, see Import-VM.
